physical_appearance:This is a list of plans and their corresponding numbers. It is printed in blue ink on a plain sheet of paper. The title is printed at the top
 and underlined. There are several handwritten inscriptions in black and blue ink at the bottom of the list. The document is quite folded and torn especially on the top-right and bottom-right corners. There is a small rusty stain at the top-center of the document.
subject_terms_1:world wars prisoners of war documents (object genre) plans (maps)
subject_terms_2:World War
 1939-1945 Prisoners of war Lists Floor plans
subject_terms_3:war personalities
subject_terms_4:
sgcool_label_text:Loose papers from the James Steele
 P.O.W archive that include a symbolic drawing
 Japanese banana money
 map of camp
 administrative papers from Changi prison pre-dating internment
 list of soldiers of a regiment as well as James Steele’s warrant to  join the army. These papers are part of the archive of James Steele
 Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942
 when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.

metadata.title_text: Miscellaneous scraps of paper from P.O.W James Steele Archives (30 pieces) P.O.W. James Steele Archives: List of Plan Numbers
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a list of plans and their corresponding numbers. It is printed in blue ink on a plain sheet of paper. The title is printed at the top, and underlined. There are several handwritten inscriptions in black and blue ink at the bottom of the list. The document is quite folded and torn especially on the top-right and bottom-right corners. There is a small rusty stain at the top-center of the document.
metadata.subject_terms_1: world wars prisoners of war documents (object genre) plans (maps)
metadata.subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Prisoners of war Lists Floor plans
metadata.sgcool_label_text: Loose papers from the James Steele, P.O.W archive that include a symbolic drawing, Japanese banana money, map of camp, administrative papers from Changi prison pre-dating internment, list of soldiers of a regiment as well as James Steele’s warrant to  join the army. These papers are part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
